meanings.definition: A batter-based cake cooked in a waffle iron.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious waffle for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She poured syrup over the golden waffle.
meanings.sent3: The waffle smiled back at me from the plate.
meanings.sent4: The waffle was a fluffy cloud on my plate.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the waffle filled the room, tempting everyone.

meanings.definition: To speak or write at length in a vague or trivial manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't waffle on about irrelevant details.
meanings.sent2: He tends to waffle when telling stories.
meanings.sent3: The teacher waffled on, putting everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her words waffled around the main point.
meanings.sent5: His speech waffled like a meandering river.

meanings.sent1: I tend to waffle between choices when shopping.
meanings.sent2: She waffled on whether to go out or stay in.
meanings.sent3: The cat waffled between two open doors.
meanings.sent4: His mind waffled back and forth on the decision.
meanings.sent5: The politician waffled on the important issue, avoiding a clear stance.
